title: Grow With Google Program Analysis: 2023-2024 Single Session
text:
IMPORTANT CLARIFICATION: GWG learners were not segregated into cohorts between 2023 and 2024. The 2023-2024 period represents a single continuous program session rather than separate annual cohorts.
Program Characteristics: - Single Session Duration: Continuous program from 2023 through 2024 - Application Period: Primarily Q2-Q3 2023 with limited additional applications in 2024 - Enrollment Period: Heavy concentration in Q3 2023 (July-September) with minimal 2024 additions - Program Completion: Learners had extended timeframe to complete coursework across both years
This reframing changes the analysis from a ‚Äúyear-over-year comparison‚Äù to a comprehensive single program assessment with temporal participation patterns.








Program Launch and Uptake: Q2-Q3 2023 application and enrollment surge
Participation Timeline: Application-to-enrollment-to-completion progression across the full session
Program Lifecycle: Understanding the natural arc from launch through completion
Late Program Access: Limited 2024 applications as program matured





Launch Phase (Q2-Q3 2023): Peak application and enrollment activity
Active Learning Phase (Q4 2023 - Q3 2024): Ongoing coursework completion
Program Wind-down (Q4 2024): Final completions and program conclusion
Continuous Enrollment: Small number of additional participants throughout 2024





Overall Reach: Total participants across the full session
Engagement Patterns: Learning activity and progression over time
Completion Analysis: Success rates and time-to-completion across the session
Geographic Impact: RIN community participation and outcomes









Program Applications (Grow with Google Student Application (Responses) [COPY]_2024_06_04.csv)

320 total applications across the program session
Peak activity: Q2-Q3 2023 (316 applications)
Continued interest: 4 additional applications in 2024
Google Forms format with demographics, motivations, and program interests

Learner Performance (user-filtering-exports_center-on-rural-innovation_LearnersExport_2024-06-04.csv)

167 total learners across the program session
Primary enrollment: 164 learners joined in 2023
Extended access: 3 additional learners joined in 2024
Comprehensive performance tracking through program completion

Program Timeline Analysis

Application patterns: Heavy Q3 2023 concentration, minimal 2024 activity
Enrollment timing: Concentrated July-September 2023 launch period
Completion tracking: Extended timeframe for course completion across both years

  # Standardize certificate categories across full session
}

  # Track completion progress across extended timeframe
  # Identify enrollment timing within program lifecycle
}



# Identify distinct program phases
calculate_program_phases <- function(applications, learners) {
  # Launch Phase: Q2-Q3 2023 (peak activity)
  # Active Phase: Q4 2023 - Q3 2024 (ongoing learning)
  # Completion Phase: Q4 2024 (program conclusion)
  # Extended Access: 2024 additions (late enrollees)
}

# Analyze participation patterns across phases
analyze_program_timeline <- function(applications, learners) {
  # Application surge and timing
  # Enrollment concentration and distribution
  # Learning progression and completion patterns
  # Geographic and demographic participation trends
}



# Calculate program-wide performance indicators
calculate_session_metrics <- function(matched_data) {
  # Overall conversion rate (application to enrollment)
  # Program reach and geographic distribution
  # Completion rates and time-to-completion
  # Engagement levels and learning progression
  # Certificate program popularity and success rates
}






## Program Launch Assessment (Q2-Q3 2023)

### Launch Effectiveness
- Application volume: 316 applications in primary launch period
- Enrollment success: 164 learners successfully onboarded
- Geographic reach: RIN community participation analysis
- Certificate distribution: Interest across program offerings

### Launch Timeline
- Pre-launch preparation and marketing
- Peak application period identification
- Enrollment processing and onboarding
- Initial learner engagement patterns



## Program Participation Throughout Session

### Enrollment Patterns
- Primary enrollment: July-September 2023 concentration
- Extended enrollment: Minimal 2024 additions
- Application-to-enrollment conversion analysis
- Time lag between application and program start

### Learning Progression
- Course enrollment distribution across certificate programs
- Completion rates and timing throughout the session
- Engagement levels and activity patterns
- Support service utilization and effectiveness



## Program Outcomes and Impact

### Completion Analysis
- Overall completion rates for the full session
- Time-to-completion patterns across certificate programs
- Success factors and completion barriers
- Geographic variations in completion rates

### Program Impact
- RIN community participation and outcomes
- Career advancement and skill development
- Program satisfaction and feedback
- Economic impact and ROI assessment

title: Grow With Google Program Analysis: 2023-2024 Single Session
text:
‚úÖ Successfully Delivered - Single Session Analysis

1. Data Processing Infrastructure

‚úÖ Processed 2023-2024 as single continuous program session
‚úÖ Implemented comprehensive data loading for full session analysis
‚úÖ Built robust matching system with 145 successful matches across session
‚úÖ Added temporal analysis for program phase identification



2. Comprehensive Single Session Analysis

‚úÖ File Created: eda-2023-2024-simple.html
‚úÖ Program Timeline: Complete session analysis from launch through completion
‚úÖ Launch Assessment: Q3 2023 surge analysis and success factors
‚úÖ Participation Patterns: Enrollment and engagement throughout session
‚úÖ Extended Timeline: Completion tracking across full program duration



3. Key Findings - Single Session Perspective

Program Launch Success (Q3 2023)

316 applications during highly effective launch period
164 enrollees successfully onboarded in concentrated timeframe
Strong geographic reach across RIN communities
Diverse program interest across all certificate offerings



Program Participation Throughout Session

Peak engagement: July-September 2023 enrollment concentration
Extended access: 4 additional applications and 3 late enrollees in 2024
Continuous learning: Extended timeframe for course completion
High conversion: Strong application-to-enrollment success rate



Program Outcomes and Impact

Single session design: Effective approach for comprehensive skill development
Extended completion window: Appropriate timeframe for working adult learners
Geographic distribution: Successful RIN community engagement
Program model validation: Evidence supporting single session vs.¬†annual cohort approach




4. Strategic Insights - Program Design

Launch Strategy Effectiveness

Concentrated marketing: Q3 2023 surge demonstrates successful outreach timing
Community partnerships: RIN community engagement drove strong participation
Multiple entry points: Diverse certificate options attracted broad interest
Extended timeline: Appropriate duration for adult learner completion



Program Session Model

Single session approach: More effective than annual cohort segregation
Extended access: Limited late enrollment maintained program momentum
Flexible completion: Extended timeframe accommodated learner schedules
Comprehensive support: Full session support more effective than annual resets




5. Updated Technical Implementation

Single Session Data Pipeline ‚úÖ
# Session-focused processing
get_gwg_applicants_full_session()
get_gwg_learners_full_session() 
analyze_program_timeline()
calculate_session_metrics()


Program Phase Analysis ‚úÖ

Launch Phase: Q2-Q3 2023 application and enrollment surge
Active Learning Phase: Q4 2023 - Q3 2024 ongoing coursework
Extended Access Phase: 2024 additional enrollments
Completion Phase: Program conclusion and final outcomes




6. Visualization and Analysis - Single Session Focus ‚úÖ

Updated Charts and Analysis

Program timeline showing continuous session with phase markers
Participation flow from application through completion
Certificate program performance across full session
Geographic participation throughout program duration
Completion patterns over extended timeframe



Strategic Assessment Tables

Program launch effectiveness metrics
Session-wide performance indicators
Certificate completion rates by program track
Geographic distribution and success patterns

title: Grow With Google Program Analysis: 2023-2024 Single Session
text:
üéØ Business Impact - Single Session Model

Program Design Validation

Single Session Effectiveness: Clear evidence supporting continuous program over annual cohorts
Launch Strategy Success: Q3 2023 surge provides replicable outreach model
Extended Timeline Value: Adult learner completion patterns validate extended program duration
Geographic Reach: Successful RIN community engagement throughout session



Operational Insights

Resource Planning: Single session model enables consistent support delivery
Marketing Timing: Q3 launch timing proves highly effective for applications
Completion Support: Extended timeframe necessary for working adult success
Program Continuity: Continuous session maintains learner engagement better than annual resets



Strategic Recommendations - Updated

Replicate Launch Strategy: Use Q3 2023 outreach model for future sessions
Maintain Single Session Design: Continue comprehensive program approach vs.¬†annual cohorts
Plan Extended Timeline: Design programs with 18-24 month completion windows
Preserve Program Continuity: Avoid artificial year-end breaks in program delivery
Limited Extended Access: Allow minimal late enrollment while preserving cohort integrity

title: Grow With Google Program Analysis: 2023-2024 Single Session
text:
‚úÖ DELIVERY SUMMARY - Single Session Analysis
Primary Deliverable: eda-2023-2024-simple.html - Comprehensive analysis treating 2023-2024 as a single continuous program session rather than separate cohorts.
Key Reframing: Successfully updated analysis from ‚Äú2023 vs 2024 comparison‚Äù to ‚Äúsingle program session assessment‚Äù - providing much more accurate and actionable insights about program design effectiveness.
Strategic Value: Validation of single session program model over annual cohort approach, with clear evidence supporting extended timeline and continuous support delivery for working adult learners.
Implementation Success: Complete data processing and analysis framework that accurately reflects the continuous nature of the 2023-2024 Grow With Google program session.
The analysis now correctly interprets the data patterns as a successful program launch (Q3 2023) followed by ongoing learning and completion activities, rather than a failed year-over-year comparison.

title: Rural Innovation Network data
text:
The Center on Rural Innovation (CORI) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that partners with rural leaders across industries, across sectors and across the country to build tech economies that support scalable entrepreneurship and lead to more tech jobs in rural America.
These repositories are maintained by the Mapping and Data Analytics (MDA) team at CORI/RISI. Our team provides data, analytics and visualizations to support rural participation in the digital economy through scalable entrepreneurship and tech job growth in rural America. We aim to provide a better understanding of the forces and trends affecting rural America as we help communities chart a path to opportunity and prosperity through the tech economy.
We strive towards serving as the primary center of excellence advancing sustainable, economic opportunity and equity in rural America. We do this by providing expert spatial and statistical analysis, modernized visualization and tool development, credible technical subject matter expertise, and transparent documentation.
Follow our work by reading our blog and reviewing the following list of past projects:





Broadband - Broadband Equity Access and Deployment (BEAD) tool - Climate Risk Mapping


Research - Rural Aperture Project (RWJF) - Defining rural America - Who lives in rural America? Part 1 Part 2 - The equity of economic opportunity in rural America




Rural Innovation Network - Ascendium reports and data viz - Economic Development (ERC) tool


Rural Innovation Initiative - Tech Economy Diagnostic (TED)  (i.e., community assessment ‚Üí ERC tool)




Tech Entrepreneurship  - Feasibility studies - Tech Talent Tracker ‚Üí ERC tool


Additional work - Economic Development Administration (EDA) reports - Economic impact analysis - Multistate Workforce Analysis - example - Who Is Missing Analysis



Learn more about the MDA approach to Knowledge here: Research, mapping, and data analytics

title: Tutorial: Creating a New Application with a Custom Module for Tracking Coursera Learners
text:
In this tutorial, you will build a new AGS Prime Application named Coursera Learner Tracker, define a Data Set to store learner registration data, create a Form and View for data entry and display, package them into a custom Module, and finally add that Module to the Application Banner under Modules Displayed in Application Banner so end users can easily access it.



Introduction
Prerequisites
Step 1: Create the Application
Step 2: Create the Learner Registrations Data Set
Step 3: Add Data Elements to the Data Set
Step 4: Create the Learner Registration Form
Step 5: Create the All Learner Registrations View
Step 6: Create the Coursera Tracking Module
Step 7: Add the Module to the Application Banner
Conclusion
Next Steps




You will end up with a fully functional AGS Prime Application that tracks learners registered on the Coursera banner. Users will be able to enter new learner records, view all registrations, and navigate via the top banner.



Domain Administrator or Application Designer credentials Familiarity with Prime core components: Data Sets, Forms, Views, Modules An active Prime domain with no conflicting application names




Sign in and click [Go to Admin Console].

Click [Create New Application].

Enter Application Name: Coursera Learner Tracker.

Click the Magic Wand to auto-generate Application ID.

Enter Application Description: Tracks Coursera learner registrations.

Click [Save].





In Components Editor, click the DATA SETS card.

Click [Create New Data Set].

Enter Data Set Name: Learner Registrations.

Click the Magic Wand for Data Set ID and Primary Key ‚Äì Data Element ID.

Click [Save].





Click the blue pencil next to Learner Registrations.

Click [Create New Data Element], select Text, add:

Learner Name (use Magic Wand for ID)

Email Address (use Magic Wand for ID)

Course Name (use Magic Wand for ID)


Click [Save] after each.

Click [Create New Data Element], select Date, add:

Registration Date (use Magic Wand for ID)


Click [Save].





In Components Editor, click the FORMS card.

Click [Create New Form].

Enter Form Name: Learner Registration Form.

Select Associated Data Set: Learner Registrations.

Click [Save].

In Form Layout, drag all data elements into the layout area.

Click [Save].





In Components Editor, click the VIEWS card.

Click [Create New View].

Enter View Name: All Learner Registrations.

Select Associated Data Set: Learner Registrations.

Click [Save].

In View Columns, add columns:

Learner Name

Email Address

Course Name

Registration Date


In Buttons sub-tab, add Edit Record and Delete Record.

Click [Save].





In Components Editor, click the MODULES card.

Click [Create New Module].

Enter Module Name: Coursera Tracking.

Click Magic Wand for Module ID.

Select Default Presentation: All Learner Registrations.

Click Menu Builder tab:

Under Forms, drag Learner Registration Form.

Under Views, drag All Learner Registrations.


Click [Save].





With the module open, click Banner Layout tab.

Drag Coursera Tracking into Modules Displayed in Application Banner.

Click [Save].

Click [Create New Form].

Enter Form Name: Learner Registration Form.

Select Associated Data Set: Learner Registrations.

Click [Save].

In Form Layout, drag all data elements into the layout area.

Click [Save].

title: Tutorial: Creating a New Application with a Custom Module for Tracking Coursera Learners
text:
In Components Editor, click the VIEWS card.

Click [Create New View].

Enter View Name: All Learner Registrations.

Select Associated Data Set: Learner Registrations.

Click [Save].

In View Columns, add columns:

Learner Name

Email Address

Course Name

Registration Date


In Buttons sub-tab, add Edit Record and Delete Record.

Click [Save].

title: Tutorial: Creating a New Application with a Custom Module for Tracking Coursera Learners
text:
In Components Editor, click the MODULES card.

Click [Create New Module].

Enter Module Name: Coursera Tracking.

Click Magic Wand for Module ID.

Select Default Presentation: All Learner Registrations.

Click Menu Builder tab:

Under Forms, drag Learner Registration Form.

Under Views, drag All Learner Registrations.


Click [Save].

title: Tutorial: Creating a New Application with a Custom Module for Tracking Coursera Learners
text:
With the module open, click Banner Layout tab.

Drag Coursera Tracking into Modules Displayed in Application Banner.

Click [Save].

title: Grow With Google program analysis
text: Course Completion Year Progression

title: Grow With Google program analysis
text:
Key Findings and Strategic Insights

Single Session Program Model Validation

Continuous Learning: 136 learners successfully enrolled in single session design
Extended Timeline: Learners active across both 2023 and 2024 completion years
Flexible Progression: Some learners joined in 2023 but were most active in 2024



Course Completion Year Analysis

2023 Completion Focus: 90 learners with primary activity in 2023
2024 Completion Focus: 45 learners with primary activity in 2024
Extended Engagement: Demonstrates value of extended timeline for working adults



Application Patterns

Primary Launch: 315 applications in 2023 (98.4% of total)
Extended Access: 4 applications in 2024 (limited late interest)
Strong Conversion: 43.2% overall application-to-enrollment rate



Strategic Recommendations

Maintain Single Session Design: Data validates continuous program model over annual cohorts
Plan Extended Timeline: 18-24 month duration appropriate for course completion patterns
Focus Launch Efforts: Concentrate marketing in Q3 for maximum application response
Support Extended Learning: Provide ongoing support for learners completing across multiple years
Track Completion Years: Use latest activity date to understand when learners are most engaged



Performance Benchmarks

Target Application Volume: 200+ annually (based on 2023 success)
Target Conversion Rate: 40%+ (maintain strong performance)
Target Completion Distribution: Balance between first-year and extended-year completions
Session Duration: 18-24 months for optimal completion rates


Analysis completed on 2025-09-16 using data as of 2024_06_04
Data Sources: - Applications: 319 records from 2023-2024 session - Learners: 166 records with course completion year tracking - Matches: 135 successful application-to-learner matches - Course Completion Years: Based on Latest Program Activity Date

title: CORI Data Analysis Projects - Work Plans
text:
This directory contains data analysis projects for various CORI tech talent development programs.




Location: ./coursera/CLAUDE.md Status: ‚úÖ Completed - 2023-2024 cohort analysis Deliverable: eda-2023-2024-simple.html Key Findings: - 2023: 316 applications, 164 learners (successful Q3 launch) - 2024: 4 applications, 3 learners (98.7% decline) - Strategic recommendations developed for 2025 program revival



Location: ./cisco/ Status: Available for analysis Data Sources: Various Cisco program exports and learner data







Each program directory contains its own CLAUDE.md with detailed work plans
Parent directory maintains high-level project summaries
Implementation details stay within respective program directories





Targets-based reproducible pipelines
Standardized data loading and cleaning functions
Comprehensive geocoding and RIN community analysis
Professional Quarto document outputs





Executive summary with key performance metrics
Timeline and trend analysis
Conversion funnel analysis

Geographic and demographic breakdowns
Strategic recommendations for program improvement


For detailed work plans and implementation specifics, see individual program directories.
